A **hill orc**, o, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. The hill orc is an [orcish](/wiki/Orc_\(monster_attribute\) "Orc (monster attribute)") monster that is the first "true" orc a [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero") will usually encounter: a hill orc is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong"), has [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"), can be seen via infravision, and will seek out [gold](/wiki/Gold "Gold"), [gems](/wiki/Gem "Gem") and other items to collect.

A hill orc has a single weapon attack.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

As part of resolving [issue #679](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/issues/679) regarding congruence between non-player monsters and their player counterparts, [commit b6a3d4b9](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/b6a3d4b984eb118ddb02f1605d76b1010df76055) gives [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance") to all orcs, except for the [goblin](/wiki/Goblin "Goblin") and [hobgoblin](/wiki/Hobgoblin "Hobgoblin") (in order to distinguish them from other orcs). All strong orcs are also capped at 18/50 [strength](/wiki/Strength "Strength") for purposes of polyself, with the exception of [Uruk-hai](/wiki/Uruk-hai "Uruk-hai"); as of [commit 651a5b21](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/651a5b210fda63a9f606ea1243300d29e410f07f), the orc-captain polyform also retains 18/\*\* strength.

## Generation

Hill orcs may generate as peaceful towards [orcish](/wiki/Orc_\(starting_race\) "Orc (starting race)") heroes, and will always be hostile towards player [elves](/wiki/Elf_\(starting_race\) "Elf (starting race)").[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) Hill orcs are often generated in large [groups](/wiki/Group "Group") of 2-11 - the group will be smaller if some of them are generated peaceful. A hill orc can [grow up](/wiki/Grow_up "Grow up") into an [orc-captain](/wiki/Orc-captain "Orc-captain").

Hill orcs may appear among the hostile [o](/wiki/Orc_\(monster_class\) "Orc (monster class)") that generate in [throne rooms](/wiki/Throne_room "Throne room"), as well as the various monsters that can be randomly generated by [looting](/wiki/Looting "Looting") a [throne](/wiki/Throne "Throne") while [confused](/wiki/Confused "Confused") and carrying gold (provided there is no [chest](/wiki/Chest "Chest") on the level).[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

In a game that has [Orcish Town](/wiki/Orcish_Town "Orcish Town"), large numbers of named hill orcs will appear around and within the town walls[\[3\]](#cite_note-3) - other named hill orcs can appear elsewhere in the [Gnomish Mines](/wiki/Gnomish_Mines "Gnomish Mines") and the main branch, carrying various looted items with them.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

Hill orcs have a 1⁄2 chance of [generating with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") an [orcish helm](/wiki/Orcish_helm "Orcish helm"), and a separate 1⁄2 chance of being given an [orcish dagger](/wiki/Orcish_dagger "Orcish dagger") or a [scimitar](/wiki/Scimitar "Scimitar"), with an equal chance for each weapon.[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)[\[7\]](#cite_note-7)

## Strategy

Hill orc are fairly easy to defeat individually, but roaming groups can pose a problem for weak and/or unprepared characters. Groups of hill orcs usually mark the first instance where you will have to use crowd control strategies, such as drawing them into a corridor so that only one of them can attack you at a time - be wary if any of them have [scrolls](/wiki/Scrolls "Scrolls") or [wands](/wiki/Wands "Wands") on hand. The scimitars that hill orcs carry can make a decent early weapon for roles that want to advance the skill, especially if they generate blessed.

Hill orcs make a decent source of food for a starting character, providing 200 nutrition; their corpses also make decent fodder for [sacrifice](/wiki/Sacrifice "Sacrifice") if you can keep them close enough to an altar. Orcish characters lack penalties for [cannibalism](/wiki/Cannibalism "Cannibalism") and stand to gain a lot more from [same-race sacrifice](/wiki/Sacrifice#Sacrificing_creatures_of_own_race "Sacrifice"), including maximizing [Luck](/wiki/Luck "Luck") and summoning peaceful [demon lords](/wiki/Demon_lords "Demon lords") and [foocubi](/wiki/Foocubi "Foocubi"). The Orcish Town altar in particular is a good candidate for player orcs to use - be sure to convert it with a non-orcish corpse first, though, as same-race sacrifice does not convert an unaligned altar and you will take a -2 Luck penalty.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

As of [commit 296a3ac2](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/296a3ac246ae12218eccff46d3ef79f46eb9068f), the scimitar skill is merged into the [saber](/wiki/Saber "Saber") skill.

## History

The hill orc is introduced in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0"), where the various orcish monsters are first differentiated from each other.

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Orc](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orc "wikipedia:Orc")***

The orcs in *NetHack* are derived from *[Dungeons & Dragons](/wiki/Dungeons_%26_Dragons "Dungeons & Dragons")*, which in turn are based on their portrayal in the works of [J. R. R. Tolkien](/wiki/J._R._R._Tolkien "J. R. R. Tolkien").

## Variants

In variants that implement [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") bonuses for wearing [racial equipment](/wiki/Racial_equipment "Racial equipment"), hill orcs may prove tougher foes than in vanilla *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*.

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), six hill orcs generate in the halls of [Grund's Stronghold](/wiki/Grund%27s_Stronghold "Grund's Stronghold").

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), 20-24 hill orcs are generated on the fourth level of the [Ruins of Moria](/wiki/Ruins_of_Moria "Ruins of Moria") at level creation.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack"), hill orcs may appear in the court of a [throne room](/wiki/Throne_room#dNetHack "Throne room") ruled by an orc-captain.

In the [Mordor Ruins variant](/wiki/Mordor_Ruins_Quest "Mordor Ruins Quest") of the [Chaos Quest](/wiki/Chaos_Quest_\(dNetHack\) "Chaos Quest (dNetHack)"), two hill orcs are generated in the Mordor fortress [throne room](/wiki/Throne_room "Throne room") on level creation.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), hill orcs grow up into [Uruk-hai](/wiki/Uruk-hai "Uruk-hai") rather than orc-captains.

## Encyclopedia entry

Orcs, bipeds with a humanoid appearance, are related to the  
goblins, but much bigger and more dangerous. The average orc  
is only moderately intelligent, has broad, muscled shoulders,  
a short neck, a sloping forehead and a thick, dark fur.  
Their lower eye-teeth are pointing forward, like a boar's.  
Female orcs are more lightly built and bare-chested. Not  
needing any clothing, they do like to dress in variegated  
apparels. Suspicious by nature, orcs live in tribes or  
hordes. They tend to live underground as well as above  
ground (but they dislike sunlight). Orcs can use all weapons,  
tools and armors that are used by men. Since they don't have  
the talent to fashion these themselves, they are constantly  
hunting for them. There is nothing a horde of orcs cannot  
use.

\[ het Boek van de Regels; Het Oog des Meesters ]

Orcish characters lack penalties for [[cannibalism]] and stand to gain a lot more from [[Sacrifice#Sacrificing creatures of own race|same-race sacrifice]], including maximizing [[Luck]] and summoning peaceful [[demon lords]] and [[foocubi]]. The Orcish Town altar in particular is a good candidate for player orcs to use - be sure to convert it with a non-orcish corpse first, though, as same-race sacrifice does not convert an unaligned altar and you will take a -2 Luck penalty.

{{upcoming|NetHack 3.7.0|As of {{commit|296a3ac246ae12218eccff46d3ef79f46eb9068f|commit 296a3ac2}}, the scimitar skill is merged into the [[saber]] skill.}}

==History==
The hill orc is introduced in [[NetHack 3.0.0]], where the various orcish monsters are first differentiated from each other.

==Origin==
{{Wikipedia|Orc}}
The orcs in ''NetHack'' are derived from ''[[Dungeons & Dragons]]'', which in turn are based on their portrayal in the works of [[J. R. R. Tolkien]].

==Variants==
In variants that implement [[AC]] bonuses for wearing [[racial equipment]], hill orcs may prove tougher foes than in vanilla ''[[NetHack]]''.

===SLASH'EM===
In [[SLASH'EM]], six hill orcs generate in the halls of [[Grund's Stronghold]].

===UnNetHack===
In [[UnNetHack]], 20-24 hill orcs are generated on the fourth level of the [[Ruins of Moria]] at level creation.

===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]], [[notdNetHack]] and [[notnotdNetHack]], hill orcs may appear in the court of a [[Throne room#dNetHack|throne room]] ruled by an orc-captain.

In the [[Mordor Ruins Quest|Mordor Ruins variant]] of the [[Chaos Quest (dNetHack)|Chaos Quest]], two hill orcs are generated in the Mordor fortress [[throne room]] on level creation.

===EvilHack===
In [[EvilHack]], hill orcs grow up into [[Uruk-hai]] rather than orc-captains.

==Encyclopedia entry==
{{encyclopedia|
Orcs, bipeds with a humanoid appearance, are related to the
goblins, but much bigger and more dangerous.  The average orc
is only moderately intelligent, has broad, muscled shoulders,
a short neck, a sloping forehead and a thick, dark fur.
Their lower eye-teeth are pointing forward, like a boar's.
Female orcs are more lightly built and bare-chested.  Not
needing any clothing, they do like to dress in variegated
apparels.  Suspicious by nature, orcs live in tribes or
hordes.  They tend to live underground as well as above
ground (but they dislike sunlight).  Orcs can use all weapons,
tools and armors that are used by men.  Since they don't have
the talent to fashion these themselves, they are constantly
hunting for them.  There is nothing a horde of orcs cannot
use.
|[ het Boek van de Regels; Het Oog des Meesters ]
}}
